body_html:
Ok once the internet cleared enough today I completely wiped my Anaconda and Tensorflow from the system and started over I created a new env just for GPU tensorFlow and reinstalled and built from scratch and once I used the solution in the other post to copy the missing library all is right with the world.. The Boston.py file runs correctly to completion and produces the scores.

Not sure who should make sure this library below is in the right spot though..between TensorFlow and Anaconda?

# cp /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6 /home/tom/anaconda3/lib/

(modify to install in the env lib directory)

Feel free to close.

body:
Ok once the internet cleared enough today I completely wiped my Anaconda and Tensorflow from the system and started over I created a new env just for GPU tensorFlow and reinstalled and built from scratch and once I used the solution in the other post to copy the missing library all is right with the world..  The Boston.py file runs correctly to completion and produces the scores. 

Not sure who should make sure this library below is in the right spot though..between TensorFlow and Anaconda?

```
# cp /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6 /home/tom/anaconda3/lib/
```

(modify to install in the env lib directory)

Feel free to close.
